Question 164) The owner of a restaurant on the banks of a highway realized that by placing an advertising plate from his restaurant along the highway, sales increased. He researched with his customers and concluded that the probability of a driver noticing an ad board is 1 2. As a result, after authorization from the competent agency, he decided to install new plates with ads from his restaurant along this highway, so that the probability of a driver noticing at least one of the installed plates was greater than 99 100.
The minimum amount of new advertising plates to be installed is
A) 99.
B) 51.
C) 50.
D) 6.
E) 1.
